tit.cmt: 原文には「わきざか」とありますが、他ファイルの「脇坂氏」（わきさか）の表記に統一するため、WAKIZAKA→WAKISAKAとしました。(参考: http://roadsite.road.jp/history/daimyo/wakisaka/wakisaka.html)

sen.j: 脇坂 安政（わきざか やすまさ、寛永10年2月19日 (旧暦)（1633年3月28日） - 元禄7年4月20日 (旧暦)（1694年5月13日）は江戸時代前期の外様大名。
sen.e: Yasumasa WAKIZAKA (March 28, 1633 - May 13, 1694) was tozama daimyo (nonhereditary feudal lord) in the early Edo period.
Yasumasa WAKISAKA (March 28, 1633 - May 13, 1694) was a tozama daimyo (nonhereditary feudal lord) in the early Edo period.
Yasumasa WAKISAKA (March 28, 1633 - May 13, 1694) was a tozama daimyo (nonhereditary feudal lord) in the early Edo period.

sen.j: 後にその出自により譜代大名（願譜代）となる（後述）。
sen.e: He later became fudai daimyo (a daimyo in hereditary vassal to the Tokugawa family)(a quasi fudai daimyo) in his origin (mentioned later).
He later became a fudai daimyo (a daimyo in hereditary vassal to the Tokugawa family) (a quasi fudai daimyo) in his origin (mentioned later).

sen.e: He later became a fudai daimyo (a daimyo in hereditary vassal to the Tokugawa family) (a quasi fudai daimyo) in his origin (mentioned later).

sen.j: 脇坂氏が現在に至るまで「龍野市の殿様」として慕われる土台を作った人物である。
sen.e: He was the person to laid the foundation for the Wakisaka clan to be respected as 'tono-sama (a person with higher rank) of Tatsuno City' until now.

sen.j: 信濃飯田藩第3代藩主、のち播磨国龍野藩初代藩主。
sen.e: He was the third lord of the Iida domain, Shinano Province and later became the first lord of the Tatsuno domain, Harima Province.

sen.j: 徳川家光期の老中であった堀田正盛の次男。
sen.e: He was the second son of Masamori HOTTA, who was roju (member of shogun's council of elders) of the Iemitsu TOKUNAGA period.

sen.j: 母は老中・酒井忠勝 (若狭国小浜藩主)の娘・あぐり。
sen.e: His mother was Aguri, who was the daughter of roju Tadakatsu SAKAI (the lord of Obama domain, Wakasa Province).

sen.e: His foster father was Yasumoto WAKIZAKA, the second lord of the Iida domain, Shinano Province.

sen.j: 正室は岸和田藩主（後に山崎藩主、浜田藩主）松平康映の娘。
sen.e: His lawful wife was the daughter of Yasuteru MATSUDAIRA, the lord of the Kishiwada domain (later became the lord of the Yamazaki domain and Hamada domain).

sen.e: His concubine was the daughter of Imai clan.

sen.j: 子は脇坂安村（長男）、脇坂安照（五男）、長女（丸岡藩主・有馬清純継室）、次女（大洲藩主・加藤泰恒正室）。
sen.e: His children was Yasumura WAKIZAKA (the eldest son), Yasuteru WAKISAKA (the fifth son), the eldest daughter (the second wife of Kiyozumi ARIMA, the lord of the Maruoka domain), the second daughter (the lawful wife of Yasutsune KATO, the lord of the Ozu domain).

sen.e: He was adopted as a heir by Yasumoto WAKIZAKA, who was the lord of the Iida domain, Shinano Province at that time.

sen.j: 名君として知られた養父・安元の元で、飯田藩の経営にも深く関わっている。
sen.e: He was deeply committed to the operation of the Iida domain under his foster father Yasumoto, who was known as the wise ruler.

sen.e: He succeeded to the family head due to his foster father's death in 1654.

sen.e: He took in his real elder brother Masanobu HOTTA, who was under house arrest by the order of the bakufu.

sen.e: The Tatsuno domain became the shogunal demesne after the Kyogoku clan changed the territory to the Marugame domain in 1658, so the castle was knocked down and abandoned.
